Function WAR2DIRECT
info:
# ALL IN ONE FUNCTION

This function takes care of WAR, RTC and SoftStart. Comments are within

name: Function RTC correction
initialize:
// Code added here will be run once
// whenever the node is started.


var rtc_t1          = global.get('rtc_t1',"file");                      // Range +3
var rtc_t2          = global.get('rtc_t2',"file");                      // Range +2
var rtc_t3          = global.get('rtc_t3',"file");                      // Range +1

var rtc_t4          = global.get('rtc_t4',"file");                      // Range -1
var rtc_t5          = global.get('rtc_t5',"file");                      // Range -2
var rtc_t6          = global.get('rtc_t6',"file");                      // Range -3

func: rbe
rbe

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
What can this function do for you?

The aim of this function is to increase efficiency (and save cost) by utilize solar energy as much as possible. When there is solar energy in abundance, you can tell the heatpump to use that energy to heat up your DHW water tank. To determine if there is enough solar energy, you need any form of power measurement. This can be a P1 power meter, or a meter directly behind your panels.

The Instruction is split into two parts.

1st part in Node-Red flow page (http://IP:1880/#flow)
Follow the instructions in the white comments in the tab: WP Solar

2nd part is the instruction of this dashboard and is written below.

Solar function

This enables / disables this function.

DHW temperature setpoints low/high

This is the target temperature for the water in DHW tank. The high setpoint will be used when solar power reached the threshold. By default, setpoint low is used at the beginning of each day.
Note: Setpoint low is NOT the same setpoint as set in HOME tab (DHW SP). They are not linked. But the setpoint low given here, will be pushed to the DHW SP at midnight and get the same value!

Power detection method

There are three options available. Option 1: Power Live (kW), option 2: Today's export (kWh) and option 3: "Today's result (kWh)".
Power Live (kW) Live energy export of the house expressed in Watt. See image 1.
Today's export (kWh) Todays energy export of the house, expressed in kWh. See image 2. This value will only increase. Energy import (at a later time) will not be subtracted from the value.
Today's result (kWh) Todays result, which is the sum of export (kWh) and import (kWh) over the house.

Threshold (XX)

This is the threshold above which the DHW setpoint high should be set as a new target.

Fallback to SP low below 0 W?

By default, once setpoint high is used, it will not switch back to setpoint low on the same day. If you do want to fall back to SP low when power production drops below zero W, enable 'fallback' toggle. This will only apply for the power detection method kW.

Override power state

When the heatpump is turned off, do you want this function to turn the heatpump on again? Enable switch to allow 'turn on' action

Block scheduled tasks

It is possible that during a Solar DHW run, a scheduled task is triggered. With this option is enabled, all tasks that changes the Operating Mode (and could end the solar run) are blocked.
Image 1: kW Production now
image 2: kwh Production today

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
WAR function (Weather Adaptable Regulation)


What can this function do for you?

The aim of this function is to dynamically change the water temperature for heating, depending on the outside weather. If it very cold outside, you likely require more heat compared to when it is warm outside to end up with a comfortable house.

WAR function on/off

Turn the function on or off. When the function is off, the correction will be fixed to 0.

Setup

You can program three x/y-points, where you give the outside temperature and the corresponding target water temperatures during heat mode.

Each horizontal line under HEAT profile, is an x/y-point in the temperature profile chart.

The top x/y-point needs to be the highest outside temperature, and the lowest x/y-point should be the lowest outside temperature.

Once the the x/y-lines have been plotted, you have your WAR temperature profile.

Each measured outside temperature will be used in a formula to calculate the corresponding water temperature accodring to your profile.
Each calculated water temperature will be rounded to whole numbers in degree C.

Export

Pressing this button will push the current WAR Temperature profile to the Panasonic heatpump.

Attention:
Native Panasonic WAR profile has 2 x/y-points
ONLY the first two points will be exported. Not three.

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
RTC Function (Room Temperature Correction)


What can this function do for you?

This function corrects the HEAT target temperature based on the actual room temperature.

Setup

The basis for the setup is the difference between measured,- and targettemperature of the room (Room Actual - Room Setpoint).

When it is too warm in the room, the default water temperature for HEAT can be decreased by 1, 2 or 3 degrees C.

The same applies to when it is too cold, but then the HEAT SP will be increased as a result.

You set the dT ranges (= Room Actual - Room Setpoint) for each correction (-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2 and 3 degree C)

The dT range is relative to the setpoint.

Turn on/off HP (optional)

Additional to the upper section, you have the option to turn off the heatpump completely when the temperature is way to high.
Ofcourse, when the temperature lowers again, you can set the trigger at which point the pump should switch on again.
If you do NOT want to make use of this feature:
set the OFF dT range a lot higher, eg. +20 degrees from the setpoint.
set the ON dT range a lot lower, eg. -20 degrees from the setpoint.


Note: By default the room temperature (Room Actual) is measured by the thermostat controller. However, it is technically possible to use a custom roomsensor.

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
Scheduler


What can the scheduler do for you?

You can program certain tasks to be started at the desired day - hour - minute.

Enable

Only rules which have the enable toggle turned on will be executed.

Description

Give your personal short description to the task you want to create.

Day

Set the day you want to trigger the action. (Multi-select days available)

Hour

Set the hour when you want to trigger the action. (Multi-select not available)

Minutes

Set the minute when you want to trigger the action. (Multi-select not available)

Note: the hour + minute will combine to your selected time. (hh:mm)

Action

Set the action you want to perform. More details on each action is given below.

Override

Set if you want the heatpump to automatically turn on when the task is fired.
If the pump is off, and the task is triggered with override disabled, it will not execute.
If the pump is off, and the task is triggered with override enabled, it will first turn on the pump, then execute.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What is the main difference between this scheduler and the Panasonic one?

The Panasonic-scheduler-scheduled tasks always turns on the heatpump when it triggers.
This scheduler offers you control over this.

Actions in more detail

Heatpump on/off: This will just turn on/off the heatpump at the specified time. Does not listen to [Override] toggle.

Force DHW: This action will do multiple things.
1 - Add DHW to the current operating mode.
2 - Turn on [Force DHW mode]
3 - Execute the DHW run to the target temperature.
4 - Turn off [Force DHW mode]
5 - Remove DHW from Operating mode again

Attention: The Force DHW run will not start if the current DHW temperature is above the set temperature in [Force DHW - Allow only below] in the section next to the scheduler. If you do not want this, set this temperature very high (eg. 100 degree C). The Panasonic internal rules (minimum dT) will always be followed.

The scheduled Force DHW action is fundamentally different compared to the switch Force DHW under Settings. The latter is the same as turning on Force DHW from thermostat. This requires certain conditions.

Force Sterelization: This action will do multiple things
1 - Add DHW to the current operating mode.
2 - Turn on [Force DHW mode] + Turn on [Force Sterelization]
3 - Execute the Sterelization run to the target temperature.
4 - Turn off [Force Sterelization mode] + Turn off [Force DHW mode]
5 - Remove DHW from Operating mode again

Quiet Mode: This will set the quiet mode to the desired level. Level 0-3.

Operation Mode: This will set the operation mode as desired.

Night reduction on/off: At the given time, this option will correct the current SP with the set temperature in [Nicht reduction - Reduce temperature with xx C] in the section next to the scheduler. [Current SP] + [NightReduction value] = [Result SP]. The value of NightReduction must be negative to lower the temperature when NR is activated.

HEAT temperature limits: Here you can program the absolut upper and lower limits you never want HEAT to go over/under. This can be used to prevent oscillating behaviour, make compressor runs longer and the HP more efficient.

Note: The The native Panasonic scheduler can be both operational. But make sure the rules do not conflict.
Safest method is to use one of the options.

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
SoftStart


What can the SoftStart function do for you?

Default behaviour of the heatpump is when it starts up the compressor will go to high Hz for a period. Only when the returning water temperature approaches the setpoint, it ramps down the Hz and get more economic.

If the SoftStart function is enabled, the HEAT setpoint will be lowered. This should cause the compressor to ramp down within minutes. When ramp down has occured, the HEAT SP will slowly be increased to the original SP.

Possible benefit is that you will have longer runs with compressor on and the startup is more efficient.

This functionality is effective after a defrost cycle when it is cold.
This function functions only for HEAT mode.

Minimum runtime:

This is the period of time this function is active for. During this period, the setpoint will continiously be checked against the Toutlet (Ta) and corrected.

SP increase cap:

This function is correcting the SP by comparing it to Toutlet (Ta). It is constantly making the SP: Toutlet -1. As a result this could mean that the SP is getting higher and higher until it is stable. This setting will limit the increase relative to the SP befor the function.

Example: Starting SP: 25C, SP cap: +2. The SoftStart function will let the SP increase to a maximum of 27C.
